reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Practical with a touch of Class
reviews.reviewText: I have tried So Many different kinds of coasters, clay, tile, wood, bamboo, cork, and, yes, silicone. Glassware slides off most of them, or collects condensation which drips when you pick up the glass, or worse, actually cling/ sticks to the glass and then falls off with a plop. My coffee mugs are often too large for many coasters, too. Most of my tables have wood and glass tops which require Something to cushion the contact between glassware and glass tabletops, as well as protect the wood from water/ moisture damage. THESE are excellent. The approximately 4 inch diameter accommodates my large mugs, have a raised edge to collect condensation, don’t stick to my glassware, and Still Look Good Enough to place stemware on. They’re sturdy and washable (don’t put them in the dishwasher as the silicone coasters can warp from the heat/dry cycle), and come in several colors. I’m glad I bought them, I bought red ones, and used them for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality and cute!
reviews.reviewText: These are good quality, durable. The color and design are both really cute. I love the silicone because it doesn’t move around on the table and it keeps the cup or glass from moving around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lots of Positive Attributes
reviews.reviewText: These are average sized coasters. The photo is intended to show which glases and mugs fit well. My oversized mugs to not fit onto any coasters. These coasters fit mugs and glasses as one would expect in terms of usual size.; however, there is a rim and it wouldn't be wise to set a glass or mug that is too big on top of it, as it would slip off. In that sense, other coasters without rims might be preferred. For regular sized glasses and mugs, I think that the rim is helpful, especially as a guide for placing the beveraged centered on to the coaster. They are not absorbent, but the rim provides some protection from small spills. Silicone isn't absorbent by nature and would not be a good choice if that characteristic were a priority. The silicone is thin. I would prefer a coaster that is thicker, though of the same quality as this set. On the other hand, these coasters don't overwhelm the glass or mug. They look nice and are good to use wiith visitors. I have visited people who use the traditional non-absorbent marble or glass coasters, and I never feel secure putting a glass or mug on them. I think that t heswe would be user-friendly with company and children. I think that they will clean well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These work great
reviews.reviewText: I really like how lightweight these are. I was using the stone coasters and got so sick of my glass sticking to the bottom. These are a silicone and they don't slip. It's nice to have something lightweight and functional. The unique design of the holder makes it look nicer than just a round plastic holder. The green is a light sage that's fairly true to the picture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great coasters, exactly what I was looking for, with a simple design. They have a lip so if your glass has any condensation, it all collects there and can be easily poured out. Only thing it that they are thinner than I anticipated but overall, still a great buy for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are lightweight and perfect size. The little lip keeps condensation contained and because they are silicone I can place them anywhere. The color and design is cute too. I appreciate having the holder to corral them when not in use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love these coasters. Easy to clean and they don’t move around. They are nice quality and nice colors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my desk at work so I would stop leaving water rings from the condensation of my coffees. They’re bendable and flexible which is great. They’re not sticky and they don’t leave any marks on my desk. I like that they have a lip so the water doesn’t fall off of them on my desk. My coworkers ended up using some of mine as well. The black is a nice inconspicuous color, most people don’t even realize what it is when they’re all stacked up together on my desk. Definitely worth the money.

These are the best coasters I have ever purchased. The fact that they’re silicone, can use for hot or cold beverages, you can put them in the dishwasher, and they look great. The holder they come with is nice as well. Especially great if you have kids, my daughter and dogs used to eat my other ones, these they can’t.
Light weight, colors are faint, it is definitely NOT worth the price. Mediocre at bestand im being generous. Did not work for me. Reviews are absolutely nonsensical.

These are the best coasters I have ever had. They are large enough for all different types of glasses, and beer mugs. They are non-slip, and any condensation on the outside of your glass stays on the coaster. As a bonus, these coasters have a very attractive design.

I love these! They look great, I love the black and geometric design inside which also gives it a bit of a grip. I also love the rim so that no water spills out onto the table. Lastly, they're super easy to clean, just a quick rise and wipe. I would definitely buy these again!

They're esthetically pleasing coasters. Since it's Silicon made they're flexible not as solid and dust particles stick to them easily. So they need to be cleaned before and after every use. Overall good coasters.
